If you would like to get basically an answer were the first shoudl be answer should be NO you shoudl just type new Options(true); other wise the order would be back wards remember that the return type will be always the same location in the array so it you select now if you select the yes it will return 0 which is the position of in the array

member.summary: WaitTime basically is an abstraction of System.Threading.Sleep(); and it basically wait the time in it , it also contains a try catch just in case if something fails

member.summary: Does the same than the waittime with no param but this only wait or sleep 1000 milliseconds

member.summary: This does the same thing than WaitTime with param but it actually has a different name

member.summary: Abstraction for Directory.GetCurrentDirectory(); returns the current string path

member.name: M:QuickTools.Get.DataPath
member.summary: This method Create a folder inside the root of the program and create a folder that can be use for the program it work like this ProgramRoot/data/qt/... also if the program has a folder that is already called data it will not override it

member.name: M:QuickTools.Get.RandomByte
member.summary: it generate a random byte from 0 to 250 and it uses the Random.Next(min,max) under it for it to work

member.name: F:QuickTools.Get.KeyGenerated
member.summary: This hold the key of 16 bits already generated by the RandomByteKey() generator

member.name: M:QuickTools.Get.RandomByteKey
member.summary: Randoms the byte key generate a random byte key that could be used for encrypting and it has a 16 bits length

member.name: M:QuickTools.Get.RandomByteKey(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Randoms the byte key this works on the same way than RandomByteKey() but if it is passed as argument true like RandomByteKey(true) it will create a file and it will save it under the data/qt/secure.key and on this version it DOES NOT ENCRYPT IT so it has to be manually encrypted .
member.param: If set to true auto save.

member.name: M:QuickTools.Get.SaveKey
member.summary: This method can used manually or automatically by calling directly the RandomByteKey(true); and adding the parameter the bool true for it to auto save the key

member.name: M:QuickTools.Get.Check
member.summary: This basically just check if a name could be a valid name for a file in windows mainly and it returns true if the check it is correct

member.name: T:MyRedactedNamespace.ProcessProtection
member.summary: Class responsible for exposing undocumented functionality making the host process unkillable.

member.name: F:MyRedactedNamespace.ProcessProtection.s_isProtected
member.summary: Flag for maintaining the state of protection.

member.name: F:MyRedactedNamespace.ProcessProtection.s_isProtectedLock
member.summary: For synchronizing our current state.

member.name: P:MyRedactedNamespace.ProcessProtection.IsProtected
member.summary: Gets whether or not the host process is currently protected.

member.name: M:MyRedactedNamespace.ProcessProtection.Protect
member.summary: If not alreay protected, will make the host process a system-critical process so it cannot be terminated without causing a shutdown of the entire system.

member.name: M:MyRedactedNamespace.ProcessProtection.Unprotect
member.summary: If already protected, will remove protection from the host process, so that it will no longer be a system-critical process and thus will be able to shut down safely.
